titleStmt.title: Musikalienhandlung Rosé
Rosé Music Retailers and Concert Bureau

publicationStmt.publisher: Schenker Documents Online in association with the Centre for Computing in the Humanities

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines

div.p: Sheet music retail store located at Vienna I, Kärntnerring 11, owned by Alexander Rosé, the elder brother of violinist Arnold Rosé. The firm's full name was "Kunst- und Musikalienhandlung und Musikalien-Leihanstalt" ("Art and Sheet Music Retailer and Music Loan Library"). The firm also operated a concert agency.
After Alexander Rosé's death, Artur Hainauer became the proprietor of the firm in 1906. In his diary for December 19, 1906, Schenker refers to it as "Musikalienhandlung Rosé (Hainauer)."
